Class PvPManager

Clients send their PvP wishes to the server and the server receives them, stores them, and sends the information back (including the other player's settings). This way all clients are informed by the server of each others' PvP settings.

                  ┌───────────┐
                  │ Client 1  │
                  └──────┬────┘
                      ▲  │
                      │  ▼
┌────┐     ┌──────┐  ┌┴───┐
│Ally├────►│Server│  │RPC ├───►┌───────────┐
│File│     │      ├──┤    │    │ Client 2  │

└────┘     └──────┘  └────┘

Friendly(String, String)

Test whether two entities are considered friends in PvP by comparing their minion master strings. Example snippet of implementation:

var minionAFriendlyToMinionB = PvPManager.Friendly(minionA.UndeadMinionMaster, minionB.UndeadMinionMaster);
var minionBFriendlyToMinionA = PvPManager.Friendly(minionA.UndeadMinionMaster, minionB.UndeadMinionMaster);
var isHostile = !(minionAFriendlyToMinionB && minionBFriendlyToMinionA);

For a real working example, please look at the Cheb's Mercenaries or Cheb's Necromancy source code.

| Improve this Doc View Source

UpdatePlayerFriendsDict(List<String>)

Update the server's dictionary of PvP friends for the local player. Snippet taken from Cheb's Mercenaries command for adding a friend via console.

var playerNames = args.Select(s => s.Trim()).ToList();
var friends = PvPManager.GetPlayerFriends();
foreach (var playerName in playerNames)
{
    if (!friends.Contains(playerName))
    {
        friends.Add(playerName);
    }
} 
PvPManager.UpdatePlayerFriendsDict(friends);

Declaration
public static void UpdatePlayerFriendsDict(List<string> list)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<System.String> list
